channel.title: Lorenzo's Daily Deep Dive
channel.description: A daily analysis of all of the AI and global news of the day I find from subscribing to a bunch of interesting newsletters
channel.itunes:author: Lorenzo Thione
channel.itunes:summary: A daily analysis of all of the AI and global news of the day I find from subscribing to a bunch of interesting newsletters

item.title: Lorenzo's Daily Deep Dive - February 24, 2026
item.description: Today's AI and global news roundup covering: OpenAI's Stargate infrastructure struggles and lessons for Anthropic, GPT-5 growth slowdown and agent evaluation challenges, SpaceX Starlink's land grab ahead of Amazon competition, Altman dismisses data centers in space, Trump's State of the Union preview, Gary Marcus on generative AI skepticism, weekly AI roundup highlights, and perspectives on college value and startup perfectionism.

item.title: Lorenzo's Daily Deep Dive - February 23, 2026
item.description: Today's AI and global news roundup covering: OpenAI's scramble for computing power after the $500B Stargate project stalled, AI consciousness fellowships and alignment seminars, the SAVE Act's hidden voter suppression threats, ECPM as the future-ready skills curriculum replacing STEM, and philosophical perspectives on pain and transcendence from Schopenhauer to Pessoa.

item.title: Lorenzo's Daily Deep Dive - February 22, 2026
item.description: Today's AI and global news roundup covering: AI agents and the tedium frontier, the productivity staircase showing AI finally appearing in the statistics, the economics of pay-to-execute agent costs and open-source alternatives, robot insurance and minimum wage effects on automation, Pentagon using Claude via Palantir, pigeon drones with neural implants, and more from Exponential View.

item.title: Lorenzo's Daily Deep Dive - February 21, 2026 (Weekend Edition)
item.description: Weekend roundup covering: Google's aggressive move into AI music generation threatening Spotify and startups, the booming high-tech home sauna trend in Silicon Valley, and a fascinating deep dive into longevity startup Mitrix Bio's radical mitochondrial transplant approach — including the story of 91-year-old physicist John Cramer's quest to extend his life.

item.title: Lorenzo's Daily Deep Dive - February 21, 2026
item.description: Today's AI and global news roundup covering: OpenAI's boosted revenue forecasts and $112B cash burn through 2030, OpenAI's 200-person AI device team building smart speakers, Silicon Valley's longevity race, AMD backstops $300M Crusoe loan, Supreme Court strikes down Trump's tariffs, GLM-5 as new open-weights AI leader, Big AI's $100M+ lobbying spend, Azeem Azhar's personal AI agent experience, the trillion-agent economy, Texas aerospace ecosystem, Meta cutting stock awards, AI predicting illness from sleep data, and women mourning deleted AI boyfriends.

item.title: Lorenzo's Daily Deep Dive - February 20, 2026
item.description: Today's AI and tech news roundup covering: eBay acquires Depop for $1.2B, Amazon's AI employee tracking via Clarity, AMD backstops $300M Crusoe AI chip loan, ZaiNar's $1B GPS alternative for physical AI, Hungryroot eyes 2026 IPO after 55% growth, Ford's $30K EV pickup bet, Zuckerberg testifies in social media trial, Perplexity drops ads, and more from The Information.

item.title: Welcome to Lorenzo's Daily Deep Dive
item.description: Lorenzo's Daily Deep Dive is a daily AI-generated podcast covering the latest in AI, tech, and business news curated from top newsletters. New episodes every morning.
